```{r, message = FALSE}
# Load libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(stringr)
source("helper.R")
```

```{r}
# Read in raw data from the Veterans surveys. These are the files downloaded from survey monkey saved as a .csv
raw_data_general <- read.csv("data/general_ma.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
raw_data_botanist <- read.csv("data/botanist_ma.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
raw_data_healing_rose <- read.csv("data/healing_rose_ma.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
```

```{r}
# Pull out all responses for Q39 (a single selection question) combine, then determine 'question n'
Q39 <- "What.is.the.primary.health.condition.for.which.you.find.cannabis.to.be.helpful...Please.select.one."

Q39_general <- get_single_selection(data = raw_data_general, q.name = Q39)
Q39_botanist <- get_single_selection(data = raw_data_botanist, q.name = Q39)
Q39_healing_rose <- get_single_selection(data = raw_data_healing_rose, q.name = Q39)
  
Q39_all <- rbind(Q39_general, Q39_botanist, Q39_healing_rose )

number_of_people <- length(unique(Q39_all$id))
```

```{r}
Q39_old <- 
  Q39_all %>%
  inner_join(sixty_plus, by = "id")
```

```{r}
Q39_mid <- 
  Q39_all %>%
  inner_join(thirty_sixty, by = "id")
```

```{r}
Q39_young <- 
  Q39_all %>%
  inner_join(under_thirty, by = "id")
```


```{r}
# Manipulate data into a graphable format
Q39_plot <- 
  Q39_all %>%
  group_by(response) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  mutate(percent_all = count / sum(count)) %>%
  mutate(percent_responded = count / number_of_people)
```

```{r}
# Plot with percents and response counts
r <- 
  ggplot(Q39_plot, aes(x = reorder(response, count), y = percent_responded)) +
  geom_bar(stat = 'identity') +
  coord_flip() +
  geom_text(aes(label= paste(round(percent_responded, 2), count, sep = "***")))

r
```

```{r}
# Save graph as PNG, plot data as csv, and all question data including response IDs as csv (save question n and N at end of plot file as "_x.x")
ggsave(filename = 'vet_q39_top_condition_cannabis.png', plot = r, device = 'png')

write.csv(Q39_plot, 'vet_q39_top_condition_cannabis_138.csv', row.names = FALSE)

write.csv(Q39_all, 'vet_q39_top_condition_cannabis_ids.csv', row.names = FALSE)
```
